# Step 2 - Modules & Libraries

* NumPy - NumPy allows easy and efficient numeric computation, and many other data science libraries are built on top of it.
* Pandas - Pandas is high-performance library for data structures and exploratory analysis. It's built on top of NumPy.
* Scikit-learn - Scikit-Learn is the premier general-purpose machine learning library in Python. It has many popular algorithms and modules for pre-processing, cross-validation, and much more.
* Matplotlib - Matplotlib is a flexible plotting and visualization library. It's powerful but somewhat cumbersome. You have the option of skipping Matplotlib for now and using Seaborn to get started (see our Seaborn recommendation below).
* Seaborn: Seaborn makes it much easier to plot common data visualizations. It's built on top of Matplotlib and offers a more pleasant high-level wrapper.

Jupyter Notebook

## NumPy

* NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing in Python

* Provides a multi-dimensional array object, various derived objects (masked arrays, matrices) and a number of routines for fast operations on arrays - 

  * Mathematical

  * Logical

  * Shape manipulation (turtle)

  * Sorting

  * Selecting

  * Basic linear algebra

  * Basic statistical operations

  * Random simulation

  * I/o

  * Discrete Fourier transforms: Search Results

    ## Featured snippet from the web

    [![Image result for Discrete Fourier transforms:](data:image/png;base64,)](https://www.google.com/search?q=Discrete+Fourier+transforms:&rlz=1C1CHZL_enAU845AU845&sxsrf=ACYBGNR9w14ZllbtHneKxKdVAJ2ZBHThsQ:1576665045432&tbm=isch&source=iu&ictx=1&fir=vGG7WJxXeKDizM%3A%2C6dhBpq97clN0VM%2C_&vet=1&usg=AI4_-kT4weJ9qGRXhEYj59lwqWDj8XbI4A&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwi0tNn__r7mAhU8IbcAHedEDJ4Q9QEwAHoECAYQAw#imgrc=vGG7WJxXeKDizM:)

    In mathematics, the **discrete Fourier transform** (DFT) converts a finite sequence of equally-spaced samples of a function into a same-length sequence of equally-spaced samples of the **discrete**-time **Fourier transform** (DTFT), which is a complex-valued function of frequency.

```
The core of the Numpy package is the "ndarray" object
```

**NumPy Arrays vs Python sequences (i.e. lists)**

* NumPy arrays have a fixed size at creation. If the size of an ndarray is changed, a new array is created and the original is deleted. This is different to python lists, which can grow dynamically
* The elements in each array are required to be of the same data type - same size in memory

```
Python Arrays. ... In programming, an array is a collection of elements of the same type. Arrays are popular in most programming languages like Java, C/C++, JavaScript and so on. However, in Python, they are not that common. When people talk about Python arrays, more often than not, they are talking about Python lists. (NumPy)
```
